title.narrative: Meeting emergency food, hygiene, and protection needs in flood affected Timor

description.narrative: The proposed project aims to meet basic immediate hygiene and food security needs, while also supporting access to GBV services for women and girls who have been displaced. Timor Leste has some of the highest rates of undernutrition in the world and the highest in Asia, against this backdrop prior to the floods the impact of COVID-19 had already exacebated a precarious food security situation. Subsequently WV proposes distribution food baskets to 600 households in Dili and Covalima . In light of the risk of COVID-19, WV will also distribute gender-sensitive hygiene kits to 500 HH (it is anticiapted these HH will have received food baskets and those who do not receive hygiene kits under this grant will receive them through other projects). The gender-sensitive hygiene kits allow women and girls to have access to sanitary products during the response, while also providing households with essential items such as soap and masks to practice positive hygiene and COVID-19 prevention behaviours.Women and girls in Timor-Leste experience high rates of gender-based violence, particularly intimate partner violence. Alarmingly, research shows these rates of violence are only expected to increase in the wake of a disaster like Tropical Cyclone Seroja and coupled with the impact of COVID-19 where movement restrictions and physical isolation policies place women at a heightened risk of being unable to escape dangerous situations and makes accessing services even more challenging. World Vision Timor Leste has been approached by the Gender and protection cluster to support GBV referral activities at 2 evacuation centres ( Joao Paolo eva center and Schola Basic 12 of October) expected to support 1132 women and girls
